Reviews.Title: “Piazza Euclide - This is no Grand Hotel Ritz”
Reviews.Author: WorldEuropeanTravel
Reviews.Content: Cesar Ritz would be turning over in his grave if he stayed at ths "Ritz". It is also no Grand Hotel in the French tradition. Be suspicious of any Italian hotel or merchandiser which plagiarizes a name - witness "Speado" which is "Speedo" in Italian. Judging by the inferior quality of this hotel, it is certainly not what the name implies. Caveat emptor. The rooms are tiny, the service is lousy, and the prices are astronomical. Why stay at a hotel far from the centro storico. There is a good bar/cafe on Piazza Euclide but that is about it. Save your money and find a pensione closer to the Piazza Venezia. Avoid booking this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok...”
Reviews.Author: alina27
Reviews.Content: i was here in May 2011. the hotel is clean, although the room is not too big. in the room you have TV & internet (also in the lobby) ..but you have to pay :(. near the hotel there is only one restaurant (good food)...but ...if you don't eat in the city.... you will starve until morning (the restaurant closes pretty early). after 10min walk you can find a carrefour. near the hotel you have the train station Euclide, from where you can take the subway - station Flaminio- to every direction: -from Flaminio station is 5 min walk to Piazza del Popolo and Via del Corso (where you have the shopping area, restaurants and access to a lot of spots to visit) - check you map - from Flaminio you can take the subway to Vatican (2 stations) ...or you can walk along the water (is much nicer and great opportunities for pictures).... enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations .Services differed from advertised.”
Reviews.Author: SweetiePeag
Reviews.Content: Could be cosy if staff was more courteous to people who didnt speak anything but English.Needs to represent the service available ensuite and not say it is when its not especially since it was prepaid.This caught them off guard as I was told to speak to my agent when in fact I was the agent. So this is the brush off that a client could get..Great restaurant two doors down for other meals since breakfast was a cattle call.... Some staff was openly rude to the clients.Pity since its a great location that gets a lot of people from everywhere...even the .train station around the corner of the next street. Advertised airport transportation is by taxi that can be arranged at front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!! Sub par hotel, Customer service is criminal.”
Reviews.Author: PabloCuellar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from June 6-12/2011 as part of a group attending a Medical congress in Rome. Congress payed for the first 5 days, I payed for the weekend. Trouble started as soon as we arrived as our reservation, as well as others from the group was not found. they seem not to have a working system other that papers scattered all over the front desk, very disorganized. and this meant wasted time for everybody. We would have changed hotel on the spot, but it was payed for so we were stuck here. So we tried to argue with the staff, and see if we could get their help on the room issue, NO!, we can't, we don't know, talk to the manager (who conveniently was never there)...I even got a "Sir, shut up" from one of the front desk employees. This went on daly, as we kept on trying to get an answer from anybody, no luck. When we changed rooms (required because of the 2 different reservations explained at the beginning), they gave us a Junior suite, apparently as a compliment for our troubles......needless to say I got charged for the upgrade on my check-out, no explanation, just pay or we call the police (literally), and again no one could get hold of the manager. I am waiting for my credit card bill, as I would not be surprised to find further charges made without my authorization.... As for the rooms: We could not be more disappointed: seriously out dated, smelly, dark and I suspect not as clean as it should be. Cable was bad, wireless cost 8 euro, breakfast was well below par, safe did not work, and the bathroom door knob was broken and I got locked in for 1/2 an hour until my wife came back from the lobby. I complained and got an empty look from the desk clerk. I travel frequently, and try to be realistic as to what i get vs what I pay for, and I must say I have rarely felt so disappointed and cheated as I was during my unfortunate stay here. The flaws of the place could have been overlooked if I had gotten a decent treatment from the hotel's staff, but the Horrifying service is what led me to write this review, so maybe others will be spared of the terrible experience. Pablo

Reviews.Title: “typical Rome hotel for group travel”
Reviews.Author: latinteacher66
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a school group for a couple of nights, and compared to other hotels I've stayed at in Rome, this one was fine. The bathroom was spacious enough, and the room was typical in size for four-star hotels in Rome. The air-conditioning worked well and stayed on all night. The food in the restaurant was good, and the staff was quick and courteous. Just around the corner is the Euclide station (undergroun) for the Roma-Viterbo train, so we were just one stop from the Flaminio station of Metro Line A.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: Kseny08
Reviews.Content: Nice place, but with poor kitchen, a bit far away rom city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the stadio flaminio.”
Reviews.Author: asharah Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We paid cc£45 per night b&b and at this price was good value for money. A great old fashioned comfortable and welcoming, beautiful hotel, let down slightly by traffic noise (this is rome, ai always a priblem) and tinned fruit at breakfast. Ask reception to turn off the room fan system for you overnight if you find variable noise distracting. They are always happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “If you can, select another hotel...”
Reviews.Author: ndlsavage
Reviews.Content: Fiasco trying to book the hotel online (they don't own their own website??). My room had clearly once been broken into: the door hinge area was all chewed up. Breakfast was a disaster, the coffee is the worst I have ever tasted, not what I expect from an Italian hotel. The bar staff was slow and rude The other reviews about the key cards not working are absolutely right, the system fails every so often and I could have easily got a key card for another room because they didn't bother to check my ID or name... Summary: shockingly bad. Steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jeannie459
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel prior to going on a Med cruise, and was apprehensive as the location was quite a distance from the city centre. However the train station is just around the corner and getting into Central Rome was easy. The area surrounding the hotel is upper class residential and very safe for walking, even in the evening. The staff were very helpful with local information and I was given a large suite on the top floor. The breakfast was continental and the coffee was good. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “too old and too expensive”
Reviews.Author: NatassaPl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very "old". Its like it comes from the sixties or seventees, without any renovation. The rooms are full of wall papers and old "tired" textiles. The curtain in the bathroom was rivened. The breakfast was poor and the quality bad. Just 3-4 choices... For this hotel we spend 245 euro for a triple room.....

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: curryqueen
Reviews.Content: WE found hotel good value, room comfortable, breakfast adequate, good selection and enough to go around! Distance to and from city not problem, bus service 910 goes from outside hotel to Termini TIP;- BE SURE to get tickets from Euclide station around the corner from hotel for bus/metro/train, and REMEMBER to activate tickets within 75 minutes of boarding - inspectors target the tourists, and we were fined 50 Euros - we had bought the tickets but hadnt activated them! Taxi from hotel to Terravision at Termini cost us 15 Euro including 2Euros for luggage! Noise was a slight problem, but nothing major, reception staff a bit surly but helpful. Would NOT recommend organised trips - evening panoramic tour costing 41 Euros was a rip-off, and the Vatican/Sistine Chapel tour costs 56 Euros - people book this one as we are told it's a 4-hour wait to get in if you're not with a tour, but we tried ourselves - got the metro and train to near Vatican (2 stops), where we were met by lots of tour guides offering us the trip for 40 Euros! We did it ourselves, there were no queues, and it cost us 15 Euros, which covered the Vatican and the Sistine Chapel. We had to pay another 7 Euros to do La Cupola, which I would highly recommend if you can climb, as the views are spectacular. I MUST add that is was in May - there may be some queues later in the season.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Italychaperone
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by the comfort of this hotel. Due to an error, they had given my co-leader and myself a room with a matrimonial bed. When we protested, the not very helpful desk guy said that one of us could sleep on the pullout couch. Our Rome tour guide and my co-leader hammered him in Italian and since they had no more rooms with two beds, we each had our own suite. Although, the brocaded walls, curtains and bedspreads gave it the air of a brothel, I was extremely comfortable. The bath was lovely with a jet tub. I didn't mind being out of the center of Rome, because the rooms were bigger and the neighborhood quiet. If you are looking for nightlife, this is not the spot, but if you want rest after long days of sightseeing, it is just fine. One train stop takes you into the city where you can walk right down the Via del Corso to everything. The breakfasts do leave a bit to be desired, but are adequate. Again, you need to request real coffee, unless you are satisfied with the Nescafe from the machines (and many are). The waitstaff is very grateful for a euro or two when they bring the coffee and will have it for you the next morning. If your dinner is part of your tour group stay, finish the pasta, because the main courses are not the best. We only had fresh vegetables after our Rome guide demanded a salad for the next day, otherwise canned peas were the norm. Overall, I would stay there again as part of tour, probably not when traveling on my own, because they do cater to tours.

Reviews.Title: “Great value luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsnape
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful (4*) and room was luxurious with marble bathroom etc as you would expect in a traditional Italian hotel. Couldn't speak highly enough of the hotel itself. Nice cocktail bar around the corner. Only downside is that it is one stop on the old underground away from Flaminio (which is the first stop on the new underground). SO it takes an extra 15 mins to get into the centre

Reviews.Title: “everything like a single star... NOT 4 star!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sueboo-s
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed 4 days at this hotel. It is definitely NOT a 4 star hotel as they had advertized. Terrible service , Terrible breakfast and small stinky rooms!! Initally when we checked in, the girl just gave us our keys and sent us to the last floor. We got to the sixth floor (last floor) and couldn't find our room ...came back downstair (with our luggage) to find out from the front desk that "oh to reach your room on last floor, you have to take the stairs after you get off the elevator on sixth floor !" Trust me it was not fun having to carry our luggage up those LONG stairs. The front dest staff had attitude whenever we asked questions or needed guidance!!They would brush us off with general answers ... not helpful at all! not to mention no smile or friendly look!! Our room was so small that both of us couldn't move in the room at the same time... no room for our luggage either had to put it on the bed! After the first night, we complained and got our room changed to a bigger one. The breakfast was AWEFUL! We had stayed at other 3 star hotels in Milan or Florence.. with great breakfast... but at Grand Hotel Ritz , the food seemed to be of the lowest quality. Location was VERY FAR from all the famous historic sites. We had to take train and buses!!! at the end of our stay when we inquired about ride to airport , the said they had this shuttle for 60.00 Euro. We politley asked if there was something cheaper. They said no and that they would only work with this shuttle and no other shuttle company. So we had to ask a stranger in the streets to call this number we had picked up from an ad in the street to call and book an airport ride for us.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: Melebone
Reviews.Content: This may not be the most chic hotel in Rome, however, the character and beauty that this hotel possessed was delightful. It was what you want to expect when you visit a city as ancient as this, something with history and a story to tell. The service was excellent and I wouldn't pick another hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “we had a good stay there - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: jaeger_37
Reviews.Content: we spend three days there and would probably given the value for money ratio do it again. as far as the location is concerned the hotel is situated in a quiet residential area with a few places to eat - bus connection and train stop just around the corner if you miss the last bus it is about 25 min walk from city center our room was big compared to rooms we have seen in other hotels in our cities (all in all around 40m2 - ante room, bedroom and bath room breakfast buffet is nothing special but adequate to sum it up the hotel for sure has seen better days (let´s face it - otherwise it would not be a 4-star hotel for this price), staff is helpful (though a little bit chaotic sometimes), rooms are clean, neighbouhood is nice and safe

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: CMDSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the final night of an Insight tour. The room they gave us smelt of smoke and was right beside the huge air conditioning fans. They told us to open our windows to get rid of the smell but when you did that you couldn't hear anything because of the noise from the fans. The front desk staff were extremely unhelpful and clueless. The breakfast was one of the worst we experienced in a hotel in Italy. The noise in the street below was horrendous with lots of screaming during the night. I didn't feel safe even with my door locked. On a good note though there was an amazing gelato shop just across the road that we enjoyed spending time in.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good location, and great food!”
Reviews.Author: Matcham16
Reviews.Content: I disagree with a lot of the negative reviews of this hotel. I stayed there for 2 nights at the beginning of a tour of Italy. The underground train stations were right down the street and we were in the city center within a few minutes. I thought the hotel felt unique and elegant with large hotel rooms by European standards. The hotel breakfasts were also quite exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here: lots of room break-ins”
Reviews.Author: javbaca
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a little less than a week. Mine and my friends computer were both stolen from our rooms while we where out. The hotel said their insurance would cover and as soon as I got home I emailed the address they gave me. Almost a month has passed and I have yet to heard back from them. To top it off, the last night I was there our key didn't work (this had happened to a number of friend's rooms also). When I arrived at the front desk they handed me a new key without asking for ID or any proof that this was my room number. This is crazy! since a number of rooms were just broken into!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings...”
Reviews.Author: Goncalo2008
Reviews.Content: The Ritz left me with mixed feelings. When I checked in I was given a room in the Regent Hotel, which is next door and run by the same company. The room was not pleasant. Very especially, it had a shoddy window frame that didn't shut well and let in all the noise from the street below. After complaining I was given a better and cosier room in the Ritz itself. The hotel as a whole needs an "aggiornamento", and so does some of the staff. Although the Ritz is not in the centre you can easily reach Piazalle Flaminio and the Piaza del Populo by train (5 minutes) as there is a station (Euclide) 2 minutes from the hotel. In the neighborhood there is two or three good coffe shops and restaurants. Summing up: I believe that, with some work, you can find better in Rome for a similar fare.

Reviews.Title: “scared of the room”
Reviews.Author: yourjoking
Reviews.Content: the hotel room did not look like the pictures,i was disappointed and scared.it was pocky and dark could not unpack only 4 hangers.double bed was 2 singles put together.the heater was broken and cracked,it should of been condemed,DANGEROUS.The rattle of the shutter kept us awake.it should not have 4 stars.the room was clean.the rooms should have 2 stars,we were on the 7th floor ,maybe the rooms below were better???????the lift was a little old,the rest of hotel was nice the breakfast was great.the bar was not open.we made the best loved rome.i would not stay again i would do my homework better next time.

Reviews.Title: “Disagree with Negative Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Bubba'sDad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on August 30 for one night prior to a cruise. The hotel was selected as part of the cruise booking so we did not know much about the hotel or location until we arrived. The hotel seems to be located in an urban residential area. Our third floor, street side room included a sitting room, bedroom, and bathroom. The tub/shower had the half-glass arrangement that others have mentioned and not a full shower curtain. The staff was professional and helpful to us non-italian speaking guests. The buffet breakfast was quite complete - a wide selection of hot and cold foods. The coffee was fine. English speaking TV channels were limited to CNN international and BBC international. Wireless computer access was allegedly available but I thought it to be too expensive to try out. We went out the hotel front door to the left, turned left at the corner, and went a block to the Euclide subway station. For one euro each and two subway stops, we popped out at the Flaminio subway station which is nearby the Piazza del Popolo, a touristy type area with plenty to see. (The subway ride was borderline unbearably hot.) We found a nearby grocery store with assistance from the front desk . We bought wine, cheese, bread, and meat for a meal instead of forging out someplace and spending a lot of money on dinner. You can look at Google (satellite view) to get an idea of what is around all these spots). Bottom line, the hotel and location were a new experience for us and perfectly satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “A negative atmosphere. Staff are unhappy and unhelpful.”
Reviews.Author: Animo2008
Reviews.Content: The staff are unfriendly, unhelpful and look like they hate their lives. Our bed-spread had a cigarette butt on it and the faulty shower went from hot to cold. It's a far distance from the centre and we had to get taxis when the train stopped. When we asked could if we extend our stay, they couldn't have given a toss either way and treated us like we were a terrible burden to their already miserable existances. When they said we couldn't stay, we didn't mind and paid extra to get out of there into a more expensive place. On the positive side, the breakfast was varied and sufficient, even if the coffee and juice was machine operated. It will dampen your stay at Rome if you stay here. It did ours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not central”
Reviews.Author: nowpetronius
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in this hotel as part of a Riveria trip. Our room was lovely, spacious, clean and a large bathroom. Breakfasts were poor, how can Italians serve up grey coffee? And tinned fruit in a country bursting with fresh was an insult. Some staff were really good and others, particularly the male manager, couldn't raise a smile. Certainly not 'centrally located' as promised by Riveria, few eating places close by, so wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “100 EUR/day - Recommend ( Hotel **** )”
Reviews.Author: AlexandreRocha
Reviews.Content: I normally try to book hotel with a budget near 150€ and four stars. And my review is centred with the PRICE vs QUALITY of service. Web of reservation: BOOKING.com Stay: 2 working days My Check In: 14:00 My Check out: 9:00 Staff: 1-10 = 7 > friendy staff and all speak english Services: 1-10 = 5 >only 5 because don`t have wifi internet Clean: 1-10 = 8 >nice room services Comfort: 1-10 = 7 >Is a old style hotel, don`t is old hotel Value for money: 1-10 = 7.5 >the price of the hotel is very accepted, the problem is that you have to pay near 50€ from the Airport of FIUMICINO, and 20-25€ to the center of Rome. Metro: No Bus: Yes Taxi: Yes Train: No (+) The hotel and the staff. (-) Don`t is in the centre of Rome. Resume: For this price and services, I going back, if I don`t have meeting in the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor”
Reviews.Author: teoand
Reviews.Content: The Lobby it's nice but the rooms are terrible, this is not what you expect from a 4 stars hotel! I was in a double room with a single occupancy and they separated the beds, my bed was very, very small and I'm not a giant. The heating control was broken, the lights decided to turn on twice during the night by itself and after my call to the reception the solution was to remove the card from the door and deactivate the entire power system! The night after the problem was the same. Bathroom smelly and very old.

Reviews.Title: “A shambolic disgrace”
Reviews.Author: Deus_ex_machina
Reviews.Content: Avoid this flea pit at all costs. It's years since it was remodelled and is decorated in a hideous, dark, gloomy style. The bathrooms of all 3 rooms we stayed in stank of, well, effluent (the drains, clearly), the showers leaked (mine soaked the carpet of my room's entrance), mould was evident on the shower tiles, the beds were hard and you could feel the springs in them, their WiFi Access (lobby only) is a joke and rarely works (6 Euros for an hour!) and breakfast was weak. To be in Rome and have to drink coffee at breakfast made in an automatic Nescafe machine is unacceptable). My co-worker's bead had a very stiff, unsavoury looking stain on the bed spread and his initial request to be moved to another room due to the fact that the bathroom stank so badly was met with an unhelpful attitude. They even sent the bell hop up to make sure he hadn't damaged the first room in some way. The level of cleanliness is very poor indeed and it's pretty noisy too. The marble halls are tired and seeing the fire hose literally hanging off of the wall is enough to show you what the hotel's owners really think about their guests' comfort and safety. My room was entirely covered in a rich, heavy fabric which smelled of cigarettes despite it being a non smoking room (apparently). The fabric was coming away in many places and it's just utterly oppressive. It's like being an an old Hammer horror movie. I half expected a bat to be trying to get in through the window.... It seemed to be full of tour parties and maybe they're happy with such squalor but I'm not. It's NO WAY a 4 Star hotel by the standards we expect for that these days (just scrapes by with a 3, at the very best) although when it was brand new I imagine it may well have lived up to it's rating. The last night we were there the lobby stank of the drains too.... I travel a lot, and sometimes you come across a place (just occasionally) that you want to warn everyone about - This is it. I've been home for less than 2 hours and feel it's my duty to ensure nobody else ends up in this miserable dump. If you're on a budget there are many other options in Rome for clealiness and location. This hotel really, truly has nothing at all endearing at all about it. It's stuck in an age which is long since past, and only a full renovation program can save it. Frankly, I'd rather sleep on the streets than go near the "Ritz" again.... If anyone pictures of this place, feel free to contact me. I've loaded a few up for starters ('phone camera unfortunately) which should give you an idea of what you can expect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pearl in the north...”
Reviews.Author: suneelupadhye
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel stay, in a very nice room (best in my Europe stay), with a courteous and helpful staff. Good value for my euro. Great complimentary breakfast. Super quick public train & bus into the city center. Fabulous little pasta and pizza place on the corner next door; best food I ate in Italy all week!! All in all, an excellent experience. Would gladly stay there again, given how easy it was to get to the central sites for a single euro ticket...

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK here, purposeful deception, run down, no management”
Reviews.Author: scots2urist
Reviews.Content: Like others I have just read reviews by, we were directed from the Ritz reception to another hotel along a hallway called the Regent. The room we were shown had two single beds instead of the double we booked as well a a burst fold away single bed in the corner in lieu of a chair. the second room was bigger but in a serious state of disrepair - it probably looked ok about 10 years ago and hasnt been touched since. the toilet was broken and constantly ran water which left a thick jelly like residue in the toilet pan - obviously not properly cleaned in months. above the sink was a bare light bulb in a broken fitting. there was black mildew all over the ceiling of the bathroom and the shower ran like a tap. In the bed room the bed was burst at the side, the chair had a dried in wet stain on the seat, the walls were covered in scrapes, scuffs and general dirt. Outside the room the carpets were so worn there was a large hole in the carpet and only one very small lift worked, the other didn't work and we were on the 8th floor. I complained to the Ritz recepetion as that was who my booking was with and asked to be given a room in the Ritz after all. the woman on reception told me there was no difference between the Ritz and the Regent but also said the fact the Ritz was fully booked while the Regent had rooms. She said there was no manager in the building - in fact she denied having any superior staff in the building at all, and the only way to get a refund was to speak to the manager in the morning. In the morning there was no manager either. A deadful and upsetting experience.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel "Lovely ambience"”
Reviews.Author: Jan1234
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel over Easter and found the hotel staff very helpful. Our room was changed with no problem as we found our safe did not work (this was done within 5 mins of us reporting the problem) Room very comfortable beautifully decorated with fabric wallpaper and luxurious drapes.Bathroom very adequate with shower and whirlpool bath. Hotel is approx 20 mins walk from Piazza del Popolo and it is right beside the tube station (tube stops at 9pm every night) A "little shudder" can be felt now and again but no big problem!!! We travelled from the airport after arriving Easy Jet (11.15am)and took a bus to Anagnina (20min journey) 1 euro cost and 1 euro extra if you have a suitcase We then purchased a day tube ticket (BIG) for 4 euros and took the tube to Flaminio changed tube to the Viterbo line and 1 stop later reached Euclide stop whichh is right beside the Hotel. Breakfast at the Hotel is continental breakfast varied choice but cooked breakfast is available if required ie 6euros for scrambled egg and bacon. We recommend The Pepperone Restaurant Via Vittorio Veneto for an excellent meal/service We definitely will be visiting Rome again and hope to visit The Grand Rirz Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chatrina
Reviews.Content: This hotel was made for Kings and Queens once upon a time. But now it is simply a beauty from the past. The hotel inside is very luxurious and looks like 5*. Before you reach to your room all corridors are super luxurious but seem old style (60s). Inside the room you see a very spacious ( like suite ) room and a very spacious bathroom with basin, with old flowered fabric on all walls and doors. The room was warm and wonderful with mirrors and many bordeau curtains. Super for a romantic night. Also wonderful to sleep there. Logical prices in minibar and restaurant. The room could be renovated a bit more however, since on the website it says last renovation on 2004, but it does not seem like this ( walls, locks, taps of the basin). Breakfast very good, and very clever staff and good hearted. I would certainly go there again although the hotel was not centrally located, because it was so beautiful, and I passed so well. The first morning I wake up too late and I lost the breakfast hours, and they gave to me breakfast in the bar without paying. I liked this a lot, not for the 5 euros I earned, but because they were very polite to me. The only bad thing was that I payed a lot of money for the phone, so do not make phone calls from the hotel. They do not have wireless internet. They have PCs in the lobby (6 euros per 8 hours). The location is very beautiful with shops and restaurants. The hotel is beside the Station Euclide. Generally, it was very good experience. If they put some money for 1-2 things they would be perfectly 5*hotel. You feel Emperor in Roma of 2006 and it is very nice feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel - Bait and Switch!!”
Reviews.Author: KatKen
Reviews.Content: We entered the Grand Hotel Ritz lobby, were escorted through the lobby, and into yet another lobby of a connecting hotel called the Hotel Regent. We asked if we were checking into the right place based on our reservations - they said yes. We were escorted to our room by an unfriendly porter. The room was tiny, dark, run-down, ugly and had a flourescent light on the ceiling. The curtains were ripped from the rod, the security lock didn't work, the bathroom door didn't close, and the view from the window was of a huge metal container which blocked daylight. It was like the Bates Motel from Hitchcock's Psycho. Plus, our reservations said GRAND HOTEL RITZ, not Hotel Regent. What a dump!! We explored and realized we were placed in the worst side of the hotel - the other side (Hotel Ritz) wasn't much better but the rooms were a little nicer. We complained - were shown another bad room (no lamp shades, only bare bulbs, and the porter said he couldn't find any shades!), and declined and went to the front desk again. We showed them the internet photo (which looked nothing like the real rooms) and demanded a better room. After 10 minutes of waiting for the rude and arrogant front desk staff we were told they made a "mistake" and we were given a top floor room, much nicer, (the shower, however, was exactly 30 inches square) with a panoramic view of the city. We were smarter Americans than they assumed, we realized it was a bait and switch scam, and we had to be pushy and demanding to get our correct room!! The breakfast was typically European (lunchmeat,cheese, hard rolls) and was served in a huge ballroom type area. It was like a mess hall in an army barrack. Upon leaving, the front desk pulled a fast one on us: we asked to be picked up at 6:00 a.m. by a taxi for the airport. They insisted we be picked up at 5:45 a.m. When we got into the taxi we learned the "day rates" start at 6:00 a.m. and we were being charged the considerably more expensive "night rates" for the difference of 15 minutes. We demanded the driver give us the cheaper rate and he did. The ONLY good things about this hotel are the following: great neighborhood - upscale, safe, very good access to public transportation into the city (train station right outside hotel door) and good little bars and a good restaurant called Pastarito. But those aren't enough reasons to stay here. See our other reviews of San Gallo Palace in Florence and Sant Elena Hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: droli
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Ritz for the last 2/4 nights during the Rome Film Festival season. The Hotel lived up to our expectations and to the pictures on the website / leaflet. The double room originally booked had a large separate bathroom but small room. We ask for a change to twin room and got a very beautiful room with Jacuzzi - much needed after a long day of sightseeing. The reception / concierge were curteous and friendly. The breakfast is just basic continental, no hot selections. We did not try the hotel restaurant but right next door is a chain restaurant called Pastarito which is excellent value. For something more clazzy you can try Euclide restaurant which is just opposite the other side of the road filled with local professionals relaxing after a days hard work. They do brilliant ice-cream as well!! The location was right next to the Euclide tram/train station, which is just one change from Flaminio Metro stop. Best to look up the times of departure during evenings as train/tram are infrequent (every 30 mins) and very crowded. The noise level is acceptable for a single glazed traditional style window with shutters that black out the room very nicely, given the fact that the hotel was located in a main road. I would return to this hotel in the future, it was better than the Grand Torero Hotel we stayed at for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “HATED IT”
Reviews.Author: Caterinafirenze
Reviews.Content: It is NOT a 4 stars hotel! The clerk were very rude, the breakfast waitress was loud and very unprofessional. We paid a discounted price and can't really complain, but it ddid nopt look like a 4 stars hotel. The room was clean and tidy, I'll give you that, but on our second day we found towels around the room and a cloth they used for cleaning on a chair. The bathroom was not that nice, no jacuzzi and the toilet seat was moving. I've been in many 3 stars better than this, don't waist your money, Rome has SO MUCH to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Good staff, but too noisy place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chosed the Ritz mainly due to its name and well known high standard in other cities, and being apart from center of Rome, price was only slightly higher than a three star Hotel in downtown and promised more confort. The good point is the well-disposed staff, ready to solve any problem in the most convenient way. The connection to the center is relatively easy, although it implies either a commuter + undergrund trains or totake a bus, which in the chaotic Rome implies half an hour of tedium guaranted. But the negative point is the noise. The Hotel has old windows that don't isolate properly and every morning we were awoke at 7-7.30 due to the traffic noise. We were in a relatively low etage, so maybe at best placed rooms it is not a problem, but it was for us. Altogether, it is not an excelent hotel at all, but it avoids a worse review doe to the staff and the price, when compared to downtown hotels of lower category.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative comments on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this hotel before I stayed there and thought about changing my booking. However, when I got there I was pleasantly surprised. The reception was very nice and similar to other 4 star hotels I have stayed in. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The lifts were on the small side if you have a lot of luggage but they have more than one so it is not a major problem. The room was nicely done out and had a safe, TV and minbar. They also had nice linen hand towels in the bathroom which you do not see that often. The shower was not the best as it was in the centre of the bath so led to some flooding but it was very warm and powerful. All in all - I enjoyed my stay there. It was located next door to the train station (5 mins to Flaminio) and had cashpoints very nearby. It is somewhere I would go back and stay at again if I were to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “HAS GOT TO BE THE WORSE 4* HOTEL - EVER”
Reviews.Author: AmazedManchester
Reviews.Content: I too was on a business trip to the 4* Grand Hotel Ritz. The only thing grand about this hotel is the name and the only thing 4* is the petrol fumes from the heavy/noisey traffic outside. I arrived at the hotel at 10.00pm after a 6 hour flight and an hour long taxi ride to be told that I was to check in at the hotels other desk, the Hotel Regent (part of the hotel - with a separate check-in desk, also supposed ot be 4*). I was shown in to a dirty lift, which lead to a dirty corridor and in to a dirtier room. I learnt my first bit of Italian then - spermico (do the translation yourself) this stained the bedding on dark bedsheet which I was supposed to sleep under! I was then moved to an other equally disgusting room until eventually they moved me to a single bed room in the Grand Hotel Ritz which was at least clean !! But incredibly noisy due to the heavy traffic outside. I could continue with the tale, as it was a nightmare from start to finish but I don't have enough space !! How this hotel can be still be advertised as a 4* is beyond me. All I can say is that there must be no governing bodies checking this hotel. My only advise to anyone who has no choice but to stay at this hotel(as I did) is to ensure you are staying the Grand Hotel Ritz (if you can put up with the noise) and do not let them con you in to staying the Hotel Regent !!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away. Avoid At Any Rate.”
Reviews.Author: duke_clar
Reviews.Content: Way worse than a rip off. Shanty hotel located near the new Auditorium. Supposed to be a 4-star, it hardly deserves more than 1. Booked by a company as a back-up option for one night (I am not aware of the rate), it should only be your very last resort option, if every other try fails. Reception: Very modest hall with fake classical décor (e.g. cheap wooden materials, etc.). Small elevators dirty and with very tired finishes. Room: Almost falling apart. Everything is or looks dirty. Decorated in a dark gloomy style. Fake drapeaux. All the wooden items (doors, desk, mini bar, etc.) heavily scratched. Bed is quite small, very soft and uncomfortable. Bathroom is worst of all: cheapest finishes one can imagine, ceiling falling apart, dirty air fan, etc. AVOID especially if you don’t like dirty environments.

Reviews.Title: “Barely provides the basics...”
Reviews.Author: skiang
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a two week vacation in Italy, with the final 5 nights spent at the hotel Grand Ritz in Rome. First the good things: The hotel is situated in a decent area with the Metro downstairs, which allows good access to most areas (as long as you are ok with some walking, it's fine). Some restaurants and shops are nearby but you will have to take the train to really get out of the residential area you're in. The hotel is generally clean and tidy and you won't have any problems with critters. Room size is decent and we whd no problems with safety. Now the bad: NOISY!!! If you want to experience what it feels like to have a garbage truck drive though your room in the middle of the night, stay at the Hotel Ritz. This place is by far the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed in and I'm not a sensitive sleeper. Whether it's cars driving by or people talking outside, it makes no difference if your windows are open or closed. The noise level is all the same. After the first night, all three couples that were travelling with us all bought ear plugs - they were all in different rooms and were all disappointed about the noise, and it was still noisy. Also, our bathroom shower had the dumbest design ever. It had this water shield at the edge of the tub that was supposed to block any splashes from getting out of the shower area. Problem is, the shield was not sealed at the bottom so as water would splash against the screen, it would just flow to the bottom of the glass and leak out. I swear, by the end of each shower, there was major flash flooding in our bathroom. Everynight my wife and I had to use all of the towels in the room to keep the bathroom from filling up with water. Also, the floors are tile and I damn near broke my neck in there walking through. Finally, the cost is ridiculous. We paid 219 euro per night and this place wasn't even up to par with chain MOTELS here in the US. To top it off, as we were checking out, the front desk was so disorganized, they didn't have any record of our length of stay or that we had paid already. We had to present them with the receipts that they gave us when we checked in to prove that we really checked in when we did and paid. In the whole mess of waiting for them to work it all out, our cabbie was outside waiting and just the wait costed us 11 euro on the meter. All in all, the place was kind of a disaster and I would look elsewhere unless you can get a killer deal. At $250 USD per night, it's robbery. At the end of the day you get a hotel so you can 1) sleep at night and 2) bathe yourself, and you can barely do either given the environment. I would advise you to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Brill”
Reviews.Author: jaynedylan
Reviews.Content: I have been back in this country for 2 days and all I can say is I want to go back!!! I loved every minute of my time in Rome the country is amazing and the hotel was just the cherry on the cake. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and only to happy to advise us of the best sites to see and best places to eat, all in all it was a very enjoyable experience. The hotel is a quite large so the only time you ever really bumped into anyone was at breakfast time. Apart from all the site seeing it was quite a relaxing time. I would certainly stay there again and hopefully will pretty soon.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: Awkward
Reviews.Content: After the ride from hell from the airport and then to be ripped off by the cabbie just for the fun of it, he over charged us by 25 Euro's total charge for a near death experience was 80 Euro's........ So first impressions of Rome were to say the least not very good. Finally arrived at the hotel the surrounding areas were not very nice. The actual hotel was in need of a lot of repair. Very dated and old fashioned. The actual rooms were very depressing. The balcony wasn't much better falling apart with wires hanging out of the wall. The staff not very helpful at all. Would not recommend this hotel. Did enjoy my time in Rome but it could of been a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “I love it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is NOT children friendly. That's why I love it so much. That's why I will go back again and again. Americans often forget that "children" is not a recognized religion in more civilized parts of the world. Bravo, Ritz! and Bravo Europe! We Americans have a lot to learn from you!
